content.text: (i) a multiple of 8,
(ii) a factor of 46,
(iii) a square number,
(iv) a cube number,
(v) a prime number.
From this list of numbers, write down
(i) 3 decimal places,
(ii) 3 significant figures.
(b) Write 0.003 857 correct to
(c) Anna invests \(\$ 16000\) at a rate of \(3.8 \%\) per year compound interest.
Calculate the value of her investment at the end of 5 years.
(d) (i) Write 48 as the product of its prime factors.
(ii) Find the lowest common multiple (LCM) of 48 and 126.
(e) The mass of a truck, \(m\) tonnes, is 28.5 tonnes, correct to 1 decimal place.
Complete this statement about the value of \(m\).
(i) Measure the size of angle \(a\).
(ii) Write down the mathematical name of this type of angle.
(i) Work out the actual distance between town \(B\) and town \(C\).
(ii) Measure the bearing of town \(C\) from town \(B\).
(b) The scale drawing shows the positions of town \(B\) and town \(C\). The scale is 1 cm represents 8 km .
The diagram shows two parallel lines and a straight line crossing them.
Find the value of \(x\) and the value of \(y\).
(d) A triangle has angles \(119^{\circ}, 31^{\circ}\) and \(d^{\circ}\).
Explain why this triangle is scalene.
You must show your working.
(e) Find the size of one interior angle of a regular 15-sided polygon.
(f) One of the angles in a parallelogram is \(64^{\circ}\).
Find the other three angles in this parallelogram.
(i) Complete the bar chart by drawing the bar for the colour red.
(ii) Write down the mode.
(iii) How many more people have a green car than have a blue car?
(a) Ranjit asks each of these 24 people the colour of their car. The bar chart shows some of these results.
(b) The table shows the size, in litres, of each of the 24 car engines.
Calculate the mean.
(i) Work out the number of hybrid cars.
(ii) The rest of the cars are either petrol or diesel. There are 8 petrol cars.
Complete the pie chart to show this information.
(c) Ranjit also asks each of the 24 people what type of car they have. The pie chart shows some of these results.
3 24 people own a car.
(i) Find the day and local time in Tokyo when the plane arrives.
Day Time
(ii) The distance the plane flies is 8820 km .
Calculate the average speed of the plane.
(a) The holiday costs \(\$ 3800\) for an adult and \(\$ 2400\) for a child. \(8 \%\) tax is then added to the cost of the holiday.
Find the total cost of the holiday, including tax, for the Perez family.
(b) The plane takes 11 hours 40 minutes to fly from Los Angeles to Tokyo.
The plane leaves on Wednesday at 1035 local time.
The local time in Tokyo is 17 hours ahead of the local time in Los Angeles.
4 Mr and Mrs Perez and their 3 children go on holiday to Tokyo.
5 (a) Apples cost \(\$ a\) per kilogram and bananas cost \(\$ b\) per kilogram. Lee buys 6 kg of apples and 8 kg of bananas.
Write down an expression, in terms of \(a\) and \(b\), for the total cost, in dollars, of the apples and the bananas.
(i) flag \(F\) onto flag \(A\),
(ii) flag \(F\) onto flag \(B\),
(iii) flag \(F\) onto flag \(C\).
(a) Describe fully the single transformation that maps
(b) On the grid, draw the image of flag \(F\) after a translation by the vector \(\left(-\frac{3}{4}\right)\).
6 The diagram shows four flags, \(F, A, B\) and \(C\), on a grid.
The area of rectangle \(A\) is equal to the area of rectangle \(B\).
Work out which rectangle has the greater perimeter and by how much.
Rectangle has the greater perimeter by cm
(b) A circle has an area of \(150 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).
Calculate the radius of this circle.
An isosceles triangle has base 12 cm and sides 16 cm .
Find the area of this triangle.
8 (a) (i) Complete the table of values for \(y=x^{2}+2 x-4\).
(ii) On the grid, draw the graph of \(y=x^{2}+2 x-4\) for \(-5 \leqslant x \leqslant 3\).
(b) A line \(L\) has an equation of \(y=5 x+7\).
Write down the equation of the line parallel to \(L\) that passes through \((0,-2)\).
9 (a) Write down the reciprocal of \(\frac{1}{3}\).
(b) Write down the value of \(3^{0}\).
(c) Find a fraction between \(\frac{3}{25}\) and \(\frac{4}{25}\).
(d) Find the difference in temperature between \(-5^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\) and \(9^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\).
(e) Write in standard form.
(f) Calculate \((5.2 \times 10^{6}) \times(3.8 \times 10^{-2})\). Give your answer in standard form.
